text: bagram maximum-security prison on the
outskirts of Kabul often described as
Afghanistan's Guantanamo Bay the US
military says the men held here are some
of the most dangerous on earth up until
now no journalist has ever been allowed
in but after two years of negotiating I
finally obtained exclusive access dr.
Angelou among our new missin Apple
listeners are me on a tour general
barracks say the man in charge here
shows me their medical facilities
although they're monitored the prisoners
are allowed to make phone call off the
guards proudly show me the quality of
food the inmates are served
compared to other prisons I've seen in
Afghanistan it's a state-of-the-art
facility some of these men have been
held here for years without trial more
Ebola has been accused by the Americans
of being a Taliban facilitator and
coordinating and conducting attacks on
Afghan and NATO forces he tells me he's
just an innocent 16 year old farmer from
Helmand and resents the Americans for
his incarceration I hate them because
I'm here for no reason of course I hate
them I want to ask them what is my crime
if they told me clearly what evidence
they have against me then I wouldn't
mind if I was in prison for 10 years but
no one is asking about us I have spent a
year far from my mother and father why
what is the reason I asked the men
filmed in this room have all just been
released but the Americans say they're
dangerous and have blood on their hands
they say there is forensic evidence to
prove it many of these people were
caught red-handed the tests on the on
their fingers of explosives on their
hands I mean it's it's not as if this
was questionable these are the hardcore
of literally maybe over a thousand that
we've already released but Afghan
authorities dispute this and say that
because of the lack of evidence they can
no longer hold them
it's an affair that is damaging
political relations at a critical moment
when US forces are drawing down their
military presence in Afghanistan the
Afghan president has described Bagram as
a Taliban making Factory exactly the
word that I used a tileable making
factory is the word that that people who
have emerged out of that present have
have been released out of that prison
have coming told me there's no denying
though that there are elements of al
Qaeda and the Taliban still in that
prison no doubt but the number of those
people who are criminals the real
criminals are a minority the Afghan
decision to release these detainees in
the face of strong American objections
reflects how the relationship between
these supposed allies is unraveling
yelder Hakim BBC News
